articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un signed an agreement Wednesday that pledges mutual aid if either country faces “aggression,” a strategic pact that comes as both face escalating standoffs with the West.
articles.title: Russia and North Korea sign partnership deal that appears to be the strongest since the Cold War

articles.author: JOHN SEEWER and PATRICK ORSAGOS
articles.description: TOLEDO, Ohio (AP) — A blast of heat and humidity in the Midwest and Northeast days before the official start of summer put a wet blanket on outdoor activities from festivals to sports camps as officials urged people to take precautions.
articles.title: Early blast of heat and humidity leaves millions sweltering across the US

articles.author: VALERIE GONZALEZ and JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Hundreds of thousands of immigrants had reason to rejoice when President Joe Biden unveiled a highly expansive plan to extend legal status to spouses of U.S. citizens but, inevitably, some were left out.
articles.title: Immigrant families rejoice over Biden's expansive move toward citizenship, while some are left out

articles.author: MORGAN LEE and ANDRÉS LEIGHTON
articles.description: ROSWELL, N.M. (AP) — Cooler weather — and the chance of rain — could bring some relief but also the risk of danger this week to firefighters battling blazes in southern New Mexico that killed one person, damaged hundreds of structures and forced thousands to evacuate.
articles.title: Cooler temps and rain could help corral blazes that forced thousands to flee New Mexico village

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: MECCA, Saudi Arabia (AP) — Hundreds of people died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia as the faithful faced intense high temperatures at Islamic holy sites in the desert kingdom, officials said Wednesday as people tried to claim their loved ones' bodies.
articles.title: Hundreds died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia amid intense heat, officials say

articles.author: HILLEL ITALIE
articles.description: Willie Mays, the electrifying “Say Hey Kid” whose singular combination of talent, drive and exuberance made him one of baseball’s greatest and most beloved players, has died.
articles.title: Willie Mays, the Giants’ electrifying ‘Say Hey Kid,’ dies at 93

articles.author: RENATA BRITO
articles.description: AMBLETEUSE, France (AP) — The rising tide crept above their waists, soaking the babies they hugged tight. Around a dozen Kurds refused to leave the cold waters of the English Channel in a futile attempt to delay the inevitable: French police had just foiled their latest attempt to reach the United Kingdom by boat.
articles.title: Strict asylum rules and poor treatment of migrants are pushing people north to the UK

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: ABOARD THE USS DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER IN THE RED SEA (AP) — The combat markings emblazoned on the F/A-18 fighter jet tell the story: 15 missiles and six drones, painted in black just below the cockpit windshield.
articles.title: A US aircraft carrier and its crew have fought Houthi attacks for months. How long can it last?

articles.author: GEOFF MULVIHILL
articles.description: Maryland this week became the latest state to announce mass pardons for people convicted of marijuana-related crimes as the nation wrestles with how to make amends for the lives disrupted in the decadeslong war on drugs.
articles.title: With pardons in Maryland, 2.5 million Americans will have marijuana convictions cleared or forgiven

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN
articles.description: LISLE, Illinois (AP) — With their bulging red eyes and their alien-like mating sound, periodical cicadas can seem scary and weird enough. But some of them really are sex-crazed zombies on speed, hijacked by a super-sized fungus.
articles.title: Collecting sex-crazed zombie cicadas on speed: Scientists track a bug-controlling super-sized fungus
